alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Culpeper; King George; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 1:58PM EDT until June 22 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Charles County in southern Maryland... Stafford County in northern Virginia... King George County in central Virginia... The City of Fredericksburg in central Virginia... Southeastern Culpeper County in northern Virginia... Southeastern Prince William County in northern Virginia... Eastern Spotsylvania County in central Virginia... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 158 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Woodbridge to 10 miles northwest of Stafford, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Stafford, Dale City, Fredericksburg, King George, Woodbridge, Quantico, Fairview Beach, Aquia Creek, Potomac Creek, Lake Ridge, Montclair, Triangle, Dumfries, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Cherry Hill, Independent Hill, Falmouth, Mason Neck and Passapatanzy. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: City of Fredericksburg; Culpeper; King George; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford
